document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the new wandering spider genus Ohvida and taxonomic remarks on Celaetycheus Simon, 1897 (Araneae: Ctenidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the new wandering spider genus Ohvida and taxonomic remarks on Celaetycheus Simon, 1897 (Araneae: Ctenidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Celaetycheus fulvorufus Franganillo 1930 : 34
(female syntypes from Cuba , Santiago de Cuba , Sierra Maestra, deposited in IES, not examined); Franganillo 1936 : 105 ; Alayón 2000 : 25 .

Celaetycheus cabriolatus pardosiformis Franganillo 1930 : 34
( holotype from Cuba , La Habana, Habana, deposited in IES, not examined); Franganillo 1936 : 105 ; Alayón 2000 : 25 . New synonymy.

Celaetycheus fulvorufus afoliatus Franganillo 1931 : 287
( holotype from Cuba , deposited in IES, not examined); Franganillo 1934 : 155 ; Franganillo 1936 : 105 ; Alayón 2000 : 25 . New synonymy.

Diagnosis. Males of
Ohvida fulvorufa
resemble those of
O. coxana
by the short retrodorsal projection on the cymbium, but can be distinguished from the remaining species of the genus by the presence of numerous prolateral short spines on the male palp tibia (
Fig. 2
A). Females of
O. fulvorufa
can be distinguished from the remaining species by the slightly elevated median epigynal area, the shape of the lateral epigynal spurs (
Fig. 2
C), and by the shape of the spermathecae (
Fig. 2
D).

Description. Male (
MCZ 32839
). Total length 8.40 . Carapace 4.60 long, 3.60 wide. Clypeus 0.10 high. Eye diameter: AME 0.15 , ALE 0.13 , PME 0.17 , PLE 0.17 . Leg measurements: I: femur 4.20 / patella 1.80 / tibia 4.30 / metatarsus 3.50 / tarsus 1.50 / total 15.30 ; II: 3.50 / 1.80 / 3.70 / 3.30 / 1.40 / 13.7 ; III: 3.70 / 1.50 / 3.10 / 3.30 / 1.20 / 12.8 ; IV: 4.60 / 1.60 / 4.20 / 5.30 / 1.70 / 17.4 . Leg spination: tibia I and II
v 2 - 2
- 2 - 2 - 2 , r 1 - 1 -0, p 1 - 1 -0, III and IV
v 2 - 2
- 2 , r 1 - 1 , p 1 - 1 ; metatarsus I, II
v 2 - 2
- 2 , p 1 - 1 - 1 , r 1 - 1 - 1 ; III
v 2 - 2
- 2 , r 1 - 1 - 1 , p- 1 - 1 - 1 , IV
v 1 - 1
- 1 - 1 - 1-2 , r 1 - 1 - 1 , p 1 - 1 - 1 . Palp: cymbium with a retrodorsal apophysis truncated; basally projected median apophysis (
Figs 2
A–B).

Female (
MCZ 32840
). Total length (abdomen prepared for scanning electron microscopy). Carapace 4.30 long and 3.30 wide. Clypeus 0.12 high. Eye diameter: AME 0.15 , ALE 0.12 , PME 0.17 , PLE 0.17 . Leg measurements: I: femur 3.40 / patella 1.50 / tibia absent/ metatarsus absent/ tarsus absent; II: 3.20 / 1.50 / 2.60 / 2.20 / 0.90 / 10.40 ; III: 2.20 / 1.40 / 2.10 / 2.20 / 0.90 / 8.80 ; IV: 3.50 / 1.50 / 3.00/ 3.90 / 1.20 / 13.10 . Leg spination: tibia I and II
v 2 - 2
- 2 - 2 - 2 , r0, p0, III and IV
v 2 - 2
- 2 , r 1 - 1 , p 1 - 1 ; metatarsus I, II
v 2 - 2
- 2 , r0, p0; III
v 2 - 2
- 2 , r 1 - 1 - 1 , p- 1 - 1 - 1 , IV
v 1 - 1
- 1 - 1 - 1-2 , r 1 - 1 - 1 , p 1 - 1 - 1 . Epigyne: copulatory ducts covering part of the spermathecae (
Fig. 2
D).

Additional material examined . CUBA :
1 male
, Sancti Spiritus, Trinidad , Buenos Aires, 2500–3500 ft ,
8–14 .V. 1936
, P. Darlington, (
MCZ 32839
);
1 male
,
1 female
, Sancti Spiritus, Trinidad , Buenos Aires, 2500–3500 ft ,
8–14 .V. 1936
, P. Darlington (
MCZ 32840
).

Remarks . The female specimen listed by
Bryant ( 1940 )
as
C. cabriolatus
and deposited in
MCZ 79122
is described here as
O. turquino
sp. nov.
